p: In addition to mimozine several phytotoxic allelochemicals were also identified in Leucaena, such phenolic compounds as quercetin, gallic, protocatechuic, p-hydroxybenzoic, p-hydroxy- phenylacetic, vanillic, ferulic, caffeic, and p-coumaric acids ( Figure 6) [ 207]. Later on, 18 more flavonoids were identified in the leaves [ 79]. The possible influence of phenolic compounds and flavonoids on the inhibition of plant growth with Leucaena extracts has been reported in several studies [ 47, 82]. Flavonoids are known to be a class of allelochemicals that effectively block mitochondrial functions [ 217]. Multiple physiological disorders, including mitochondrial one, observed in Eichhornia crassipes leaf disks treated by leachate of L. leucocephala imply the combined effect of several phytotoxic compounds on multiple target sites at multiple cellular levels [ 83].
